html: In his humiliating downfall, the tyrannical “man” who lorded it over the nations is a sight to wonder at. Although he gained the whole world, it profited him nothing as he suffers the loss of his own soul (cf. Matthew 16:26). Instead of being a power of creation—a god who benefits humanity—he is a power of chaos who orchestrates horrific destruction of life and property. He who made the earth “shake” and kingdoms “quake” (Isaiah 5:25; 24:18; 54:10), who turned the world into a “wilderness” and demolished its “cities” (Isaiah 7:20-25; 32:19; 64:10-11), has become an object of derision.
